intro: Acinodendron myrtillifolium, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved acinodendron, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves that resemble those of myrtle, hence its common name. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
